intro: Cordia podocephala, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Cordia podocephala is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
